task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, transport it, and place it centered on the red plate, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base xArm with a parallel gripper must perform a pick-and-place: locate a white plate on a green table, grasp it from the top, and then place it accurately onto a nearby red plate/tray visible in multiple frames. The behavior addresses perception uncertainties by falling back to a scan if visibility checks fail, uses a computed top grasp, and applies a gentle, contact-based placement before releasing. The sequence concludes with a short retreat and wait to ensure stability and clearance around the placed item.
preconditions: Robot is powered, homed, and gripper operational
Workspace contains a white plate and a red plate within reachable area
Camera stream provides sufficient view of both plates
No obstacles between grasp and place locations
stepwise_plan: Initialize by opening gripper and ensuring the white plate is detected or scanned for
Approach above the white plate, compute a top grasp, align, and execute the pick
Verify grasp stability and move toward the red plate area
Detect the red plate, set a target place pose, approach, and descend until contact
Press to seat the plate, release, retreat, and pause briefly
success_criteria: White plate lifted securely without slipping
White plate placed centered on the red plate with stable support
Gripper fully releases and robot retreats to a safe clearance
failure_and_recovery: If the plate is not visible, perform spiral scan and re-detect
If grasp is unstable, recompute grasp and retry pick
If contact not detected while placing, adjust height and attempt again
task_long_description.termination: End after successful release on the red plate followed by retreat and short wait

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and lift of the white plate is visible, indicating the grasp executed successfully
frame_3.predicts_next: transition to transfer and placement is expected immediately after lift-off

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Root sequence for pick and place
Visibility or scan for white plate
Check if white plate is visible
Visibility or scan for red plate
Check if red plate is visible

failure_modes: White plate not detected due to glare or occlusion
Grasp fails or slips during lift
Red plate pose mislocalized causing misplacement
No contact detected when descending to place
recovery_strategy: Invoke spiral scan and re-detect target
Recompute grasp pose and retry pick
Re-detect red plate and reset place pose
Bound descent depth; if no contact, retry with adjusted height
assumptions: Frames show a white plate being grasped and moved toward a red plate; exact center pose is approximated via a symbolic place pose key
Top grasp is feasible given plate geometry; suction not required
Contact threshold of 10.0 is sufficient to confirm support without excessive force

expected_success_criteria: White plate is on red plate with no slip after release
Robot retreats with open gripper and no collision
